SHOW.TITLE: Breaking Bad
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: A high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer turns to manufacturing and selling methamphetamine in order to secure his family's future.

SHOW.TITLE: Game Of Thrones
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: Nine noble families fight for control over the lands of Westeros, while an ancient enemy returns after being dormant for millennia.

SHOW.TITLE: The Mandalorian
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The travels of a lone bounty hunter in the outer reaches of the galaxy, far from the authority of the New Republic.

SHOW.TITLE: Friends
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: Follows the personal and professional lives of six twenty to thirty-something-year-old friends living in Manhattan.

SHOW.TITLE: The Sopranos
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: New Jersey mob boss Tony Soprano deals with personal and professional issues in his home and business life that affect his mental state, leading him to seek professional psychiatric counseling.

SHOW.TITLE: The Wonder Years
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: Kevin Arnold recalls growing up during the late 60s and early 70s; the turbulent social times make the transition from child to adult unusually interesting.

SHOW.TITLE: Seinfeld
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The continuing misadventures of neurotic New York City stand-up comedian Jerry Seinfeld and his equally neurotic New York City friends.

SHOW.TITLE: House Of Cards
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: A Congressman works with his equally conniving wife to exact revenge on the people who betrayed him.

SHOW.TITLE: Lost
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The survivors of a plane crash are forced to work together in order to survive on a seemingly deserted tropical island.

SHOW.TITLE: Westworld
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: Set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, explore a world in which every human appetite can be indulged without consequence.

SHOW.TITLE: Stranger Things
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: When a young boy disappears, his mother, a police chief and his friends must confront terrifying supernatural forces in order to get him back.

SHOW.TITLE: The X Files
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: Two F.B.I. Agents, Fox Mulder the believer and Dana Scully the skeptic, investigate the strange and unexplained, while hidden forces work to impede their efforts.

SHOW.TITLE: Chernobyl
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: In April 1986, an explosion at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics becomes one of the world's worst man-made catastrophes.

SHOW.TITLE: Better Call Saul
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The trials and tribulations of criminal lawyer Jimmy McGill in the time before he established his strip-mall law office in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

SHOW.TITLE: Narcos
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: A chronicled look at the criminal exploits of Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar, as well as the many other drug kingpins who plagued the country through the years.

SHOW.TITLE: Family Guy
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: In a wacky Rhode Island town, a dysfunctional family strive to cope with everyday life as they are thrown from one crazy scenario to another.

SHOW.TITLE: Parks And Recreation
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The absurd antics of an Indiana town's public officials as they pursue sundry projects to make their city a better place.

SHOW.TITLE: The Simpsons
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The satiric adventures of a working-class family in the misfit city of Springfield.

SHOW.TITLE: The Wire
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: The Baltimore drug scene, as seen through the eyes of drug dealers and law enforcement.

SHOW.TITLE: Rome
SHOW.DESCRIPTION: A down-to-earth account of the lives of both illustrious and ordinary Romans set in the last days of the Roman Republic.
